div.p: Miss Ellen Smith,
11 Hatton Street,
Jackson,
Tenn,
From J.L.D
Co L 23
Say if you know Esthers add give it to me for I never did write to her. I guess her husban wont shoot me
Camp Laurel Md.
March 9-1918
Dear Ellen:
Guess you thank I have forgotten you but I havent. I have been real busy for some time and havent had time to write
I have been on guard and when that job comes around it keeps a fellow busy for a while And yesterday I was out in the woods all day cutting wood for the Camp
But it has been raining here to day so didnt have to do any thing I am like a kid on the farm glad to see it rain so will get to rest and tomorrow is sunday
so thank I will catch up with my writing
I got my weeks washing done this morning so tomorrow I hope I wont have any thing to do.
But I bet will be my luck to have to work all day at some thing and if I do well I wont say it here just thank it
I have quit shooting I guess I was such a sorry Marksman they thought the time was wasted so they put me to work.
Well I should worry I dont want a rifle any way. I will give these men that can shoot my rifle and I will do the work for believe me they soon get heavy when we go no hikes
We had a hike the other day had all that pack I was telling you about once before Only it was heavy this time then it was before and we
had rifles this time so all together the pack weighs 70 pounds
Every one of us thought we were leaving for parts unknowne They told us we were but they were only fooling we came back here and believe me the men were some sore about it They want to leave here
But I dont know when it will come I hope some time soon I want to leave this place I have been here long enough I dont care where we go I like to go to a new place
I soon get tired of a place and more especially this place we are about 10 miles from no where out in the woods and I never see any one but soldiers
I guess if I were to see a lady
wood be afraid of her

Well tomorrow is when Esther get married wish I could see the show I guess they will leve Monday Morning for ther new home in Bhm. I hate to thank of it for when I come back home wont seem right for me not to see her running around in the front yard.

Sure is a fine old girl if she get as good a husban as he does a wife they will be alright through this old world Of course I dont mean to say he is not a good fellow I dont know anything about him But I hope he will be good to her
I know you will be lost with out her Who will yu have for a girl friend I cant think of any lady that ever
close like she does
I guess I will have to come home and keep you from getting lonesome Oh there is Bob he can keep you from being lonesome
Has Bob got his barbershop that he had before the went away What has happened around Jackson that you thank would be news to me?
Do they have any thing except picture shows to go and pass away the time? I sure would like to see a show I havent been to a show since I left home
When I was in Baltimore that sunday ever thing was close up as tight as a jug
And I have only been out
of Camp twice since I enlisted once in Baltimore and the other time I was at a dance at Annapolis Md.
I sure would like to get out of jail and see how I would feel. But I dont see any chance Some time I have to stop and thank who we are at war with.
I will be good when the time comes for us to go to France I am going to try to transfer out of this regt. as soon as we get across
I dont know what kind of luck I will have but I am going to do my best I cant get in to any thing that will be any worse than this regt.
I some times wish I had waited and let them draft Me The drafted men get better treatment than we do. So they tell me
I know they do get out of Camp some time and I dont
I guess I had better hesh or I will wake up in the guard house They censor all of the mail that leaves here But when I get wound up I cant help it Its in me and has got to come out
I am in the tent all by self to night All the other boys are on guard so I feel real lonesome with out them But when they are here they talk so murch I can't write with any sense
We have got a new bunch in the tent Orr Cortmell and My self are the only one of the old bunch left Orr dont have any one to argue with now
But after supper when the
other bunch was together Orr would start an argument with a fellow by the name of Ralf and such a time they would have
Say you tell Bernard if he dont send Orr his watch pretty soon he will curse enough to send him to ____ a dozen times
He sent Dick Lane the money about a month ago to see Bernard and get his watch and send to him but it hasent come yet and we are expecting to leave here any day
Well I thank I have told you ever thing I know So will quit for this time write me real soon and tell me all the news and all about Esthers Wedding
with lots of love
I am the same old boy
J.L.Dodds
Co L 23 Engr
Laurel
Md.
